greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of nonzero digits of n in factorial base.
comment: a(0) = 1 as an empty product always gives 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5040
program: (define (n->factbase n) (let loop ((n n) (fex (if (zero? n) (list 0) (list))) (i 2)) (cond ((zero? n) fex) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ n i)) (cons (modulo n i) fex) (1+ i))))))
return n if n
return 1 if n<2 else reduce(mul, [int(i) for i in str(A(n - 1)) if i!="0"])
print([a(n) for n in range(201)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 19 2017
xref: A227157 gives the positions where equal with A208575.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 04 2013
